intro: Arnebia saxatile, commonly known as the rock balm, is a flowering plant native to arid and rocky regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically blooms in shades of pink or red, adding a striking visual element to its harsh environment. Its leaves are usually narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry conditions. Arnebia saxatile is often found growing on slopes and in rocky crevices, showcasing its resilience to extreme climates.
